results.title: Apocalypse now
results.creator_credit: Francis Ford Coppola and Omni Zoetrope
results.brief_description: Francis Ford Coppola’s stunning vision of man’s heart of darkness, revealed through the particular madness of the Vietnam War. Lieutenant Willard (Martin Sheen) receives orders to seek out the renegade Colonel Kurtz (Marlon Brando) who has disappeared into the depths of the jungle. Willard’s mission becomes an epic journey into his own soul and that of the mysterious Kurtz. Based on the novella by Joseph Conrad, “Heart of Darkness”. Original music by Carmine Coppola, Francis Ford Coppola, Mickey Hart.

results.title: Aplekage: the art of Stewart Merrett
results.creator_credit: Trevor George Lucas, Andromeda Productions, Dunkirk Traders and Russell Hurley
results.brief_description: Stewart Merrett works in a fabric art form that is colourful, understandable and very popular. He likes to think that people who call themselves artists can actually draw, that they have some intrinsic craft.

results.title: Aphids
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and ERPI Classroom Films
results.brief_description: Deals with periods in the life-history of the common plant louse; close-ups show the insect laying eggs, moulting and feeding. A time-lapse study is used to show wing development; microcinematography shows details of the insect’s beck.

results.title: Apemen of Africa
results.brief_description: The processes involved in pinpointing the appearance of humans on earth are discussed in this film. Fossils discovered in South Africa in 1924 bore evidence that humans first appeared in Africa, not Asia, contrary to prevailing scientific opinion. Shows how further discoveries by anthropologists proved without doubt the existence of a human-like creature who lived in Africa as long as three and a half million years ago. Narrated by E. G. Marshall

results.title: Apartment zero
results.brief_description: When lonely, uptight cinema owner and film buff Adrian (Colin Firth) advertises for a lodger to share his opulent Buenos Aires apartment, he attracts Jack (Ed Bochner), a suave easy-going American. Before long Adrian is seduced by Jack’s charm and becomes infatuated with him, suffering fits of jealously when Jack befriends the eccentric tenants of neighbouring apartments whom Adrian reviles. Meanwhile, a brutal serial murderer is terrorising the city, the style of the killings suggesting the killer may have been part of the death squad at the service of the former regime. While Adrian and Jack are polar opposites of each other, either one could potentially be the murderer. Like his institutionalised mother, Adrian is psychologically unstable while Jack is concealing a dubious past. Suspense builds to an unexpected climax as the killer’s identity becomes clear. Overly ambitious in its scope the film nevertheless succeeds in creating a brooding homoerotic tension between the two men which is ultimately realised through violence rather than sexual gratification.

results.title: Aorere: an attempt at change
results.creator_credit: Zero Sixteen Films and Department of Education, New Zealand
results.brief_description: The headmaster of Aorere College in South Auckland, New Zealand, believes that the resources of secondary schools should be used more completely. Shows the ways in which other members of the community share the facilities of Aorere College.
